meanings.definition: A person or thing that excludes others.
meanings.sent1: The excluders at the party made sure no one else could join.
meanings.sent2: The school playground excluders wouldn't let anyone play with them.
meanings.sent3: The excluders in the game of tag were the champions of keeping others away.
meanings.sent4: Her cold demeanor acted as an invisible excluder, pushing people away.
meanings.sent5: The excluders in the club were like bouncers, only letting in the chosen few.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to prevent entry or access.
meanings.sent1: The security excluders at the entrance required a special key card.
meanings.sent2: The gate excluders were set up to keep animals out of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The excluders on the door were so high-tech, they only opened for specific individuals.
meanings.sent4: The excluders on the fence acted like a shield, blocking unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent5: The excluders on the computer system prevented unauthorized users from gaining access.

meanings.definition: A policy or practice that keeps certain individuals or groups out.
meanings.sent1: The strict excluders in the club meant only members could enter.
meanings.sent2: The company's excluders on hiring practices aimed to maintain a certain culture.
meanings.sent3: The excluders on the VIP list made sure only the elite could attend the event.
meanings.sent4: The excluders in the selection process ensured only the most qualified candidates were chosen.
meanings.sent5: The excluders in the neighborhood association kept the community exclusive and tight-knit.
